intro: Saracha domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican saracha, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
